title: Changed layout.css.devPixelsPerPx to 16 and now can't get back to where it was
content:
I've been using Thunderbird as my e-mail client for a while now - it's great. It recently (last few days (today = 5/10/23)) did an automatic upgrade. With the new version the basic font size was smaller. So the lists of all e-mails in inbox, sent box etc etc were in a smaller font than before. I find them a bit small for reading.

I googled how to change this and found a page that said to to Settings... search for EditorConfig and then change the parameter

layout.css.devPixelsPerPx

This was set at -1.0 (note negative sign)

I tried changing it to 16.

A MISTAKE! Now everything Thunderbird related is huge! On my screen I can only see the menu items File Edit View - these now fill the whole width of the screen. Thunderbird has become unusable. I attach a screen shot of my whole screen....

I can't seem to move the window contents around so I can't get anywhere near the Settings menu item.

Because I can't see anything of any value, I cant get back to Settings to change the configuration back.

Two questions:

a) is there a way to change this setting back to -1.0 without using Thunderbird (eg my manually editing a text file or the windows registry)?

b) is this the right way to increase the basic font size used by the Thunderbird user GUI?

Regards, Roger
creator: roger117

title: GTK (Linux Mint) Theme Broken After Thunderbird Update
content: If you are going to give us an update that breaks our Custom Linux Themes (in my case Linux Mint 20.1 Cinnamon Edition) then why not give us the option to customize all the colors in Thunderbird so we can pick an area and change its colour to what we want?? The latest update to Thunderbird Supernova has left my custom purple theme for linux dysfunctional in Thunderbird (which it has worked ever since I made the theme). Now all I have is dark grey parts all over the place and I can't change it!! Updates are supposed to be improvements not break existing things that worked perfectly for years!! Now I am stuck with this half broken dark grey ugly theme and I am looking at replacement email programs because it is so disgusting!! It was like all fine yesterday!!

Is there such a feature? Would it be possible to add it to a wish list?

title: New messages are not shown in the list when opening a folder
content:
In older versions, when selecting a folder with unread messages, the message list pane would normally show the first two unread messages. But in Supernova 115, it shows either just one or in many cases none.

For example, I just selected a folder with an unread message which I know is from today, but the message list has opened to show me email from 2013.

Selecting another folder, with 2 new messages, the list shows me emails from June. Pressing N takes the list to the first unread, but the second is still off-screen.

Have I missed a setting option somewhere? I don't think so!
creator: mail1852

title: Since Supernova I get an error message when pressing send, click OK, press send and it goes
content:
Hi,

Since the Supernova update on Thunderbird I get the following message when I press send:

Sending of the message failed. An error occurred while sending mail. The mail server responded: too long without DATA command (closing session). Please verify that your email address is correct in your account settings and try again.

Naturally all the details of my account are correct. It happens virtually every time I send an e mail. If I click on OK, and then press Send again the e mail goes. Bug?

Thanks

Mitt Morris
creator: Tootie

title: Thunderbird delete does not use local Deleted folder
content:
When I delete a Thunderbird message from a local folder, it is permanently deleted and not moved to the local Deleted folder. It happens regardless of whether I use the Delete key or the button in the viewing pane.

Deleting server messages works as expected - it DOES use the Deleted folder on the server.

The most recent message in my local Deleted folder is dated 1 May 2023, so it seems to be a new problem in version 115, or possibly the previous version to that.

Is there any way to control what happens to a deleted message?

E' stato notato che, durante la creazione di nuovi eventi su un calendario che coinvolga partecipanti, il plugin non invia il messaggio agli invitati. Al contrario, viene inviata solo una mail di accettazione all'utente che ha creato l'evento.

title: TB looks totally different all of a sudden [Ubuntu]
content:
Hello,

I'm on Ubtuntu 20.04 and I'd just started up Thunderbird to check my mail today. But suddenly it looked totally different from when I started it yesterday (2023-10-04). Round edges now, a lot more brown/grey, somehow a window within a window (Two Window headers with buttons for min, max and closing the window), number of unread Messages is now in a rounded box...

Only explanation I can come up with is that there was a hidden automatic update between 2023-10-04 and 2023-10-05, but I couldn't find any info on that. I did get no information of an update, it just looked different suddenly. Have tried to reset View to the old look, have tried to install an older version (thunderbird-114.0b6) - but it's still that new, confusing look.

Can anyone tell me how to revert to the old view - or an older version?


Thank you very much! Jon

title: Funzione rimossa o solo nascosta?
content:
Buongiorno, una funzione che trovo/trovavo veramente utile era quella di poter istantaneamente vedere la cronistoria di una conversazione, con un solo click. Purtroppo non ricordo più il nome di tale funzione e non riesco a capire se è 1)stata rimossa con il nuovo Supernova 2)nascosta/spostata da qualche parte e che non riesco a trovare.

Una volta selezionata una email, trovavo questa funzione sopra il pannello di destra (quello dove si apre l'anteprima dell'email stessa) dove ci sono anche i pulsanti Rispondi, Rispondi a tutti, Inoltra, Archivia etc. L'ultimo è "Altro" e dal menu a tendina, non ricordo se era la prima funzione o tra le prime funzioni, potevo cliccare e mi si apriva la finestra con l'esploso della conversazione, senza dover fare mille ricerche.

C'è nessuno che mi può aiutare a capire come riavere tale funzione senza la quale non so se riuscirò più a vivere :( Grazie Martin
creator: m4rtinlevelling

title: Scrolling email list with up and down arrows.
content: When scrolling through emails each day, I have always used my left hand on the mouse and my right hand on keyboard up and down arrows. This way, when I get to an email to delete or junk (most of 'em these days!) I simply use the mouse to click delete/junk/move, whatever it needs, then continue to scroll with the Down arrow. It seems with new Supernova that this is no longer possible. If an email is highlighted then I can arrow scroll as usual but as soon as I,say, delete one then I loose the highlight bar (it's gone with the deleted email) and the arrows no longer work until I use the mouse to highlight another email. Am I missing something here or has this characteristic been removed? (hope I've described this clearly) Thanks Chris

title: Help needed troubleshooting automatic junk filter
content:
I've been using Thunderbird for years and love it! I have multiple email addresses, but I'm having problems for a good year or so with one of my gmail accounts that gets a lot of junk mail. Gmail filters suspected junk mail and places it in a folder called spam. I know how to use webmail and mark an email as not spam. I also know how to setup a filter that says, Never send to spam. Despite taking these steps, I have messages that within a minute of marking "not spam", end up moving right back to the spam folder. I've been trying everything I can think of and then I found under settings that I could uncheck Show in IMAP for the Spam folder and it wouldn't appear in Thunderbird. <see image attached> Once I did that, I could mark a message as "not spam" or just move back to my inbox through webmail and it will now stay in the inbox. But that means I can't view the spam folder through Thunderbird, which isn't ideal.

So I need help determining what is causing the emails to move from the Inbox to Spam when IMAP is turned on for the Spam folder and I open Thunderbird so that I can hopefully stop Thunderbird from moving them. I've tried unchecking adaptive junk mail, SpamAssassin, and Move new junk messages. <see images attached>

What can I do and where can I look to determine what is causing the emails to move when Spam is turned on in IMAP?

Thanks in advance for your help, Elspeth Coats
creator: webcoats

title: A way to measure which senders and/or subjects are consuming the most mailbox space (in gmail)
content:

I know there are some extensions that calculate statistics, but I'm not seeing "newsletter X is Y Megabytes total", or Here are your "senders (From: or Reply-to: etc.)" ranked from largest % of your mailbox to smallest.

I have something like 15+ years of email, and I know there's a bunch of newsletters that are no longer useful buried in there but it's not easy to find the biggest few and delete those.

title: View Source of an Email Without Opening It
content:
I just updated to the newest version of Thunderbird and honestly I hate the new layout. However, I have always used View/Source to check if an email is spam that got through without opening the email. What happened to that option? I do not want to open an email to view the source of it. View doesn't have that option, and if it's hiding, I sure can't find it.

I've mentioned before, too, that sometime back Thunderbird removed the distinction between which emails were read and which weren't. I've been hoping that function would come back, but so far it is still elusive, just like View Source.

Another thing that is frustrating is the removal of "File". Yes, I do not like this new update. As far as I'm concerned it is far from intuitive and clumsy. I may have to find another email client to replace the one I have used forever. Sad.

But, please, can someone point me to where I can restore the View contents that include View/Source at the bottom? Am I going to have to poke around in the config to see if it's hidden there now?

Thanks!

"Not the bunny"
